description: From French briquette, from brique (“brick”) + -ette (“forming diminutives”).

entries.meaning: A small brick, typically made of charcoal and used for fuel.
examples: […]  an eggette or briquette manufacturing contract, where, by the compression of tar with these fine particles of culm, there are made pieces of coal about the size of an egg  […]

entries.meaning: A block of artificial stone in the form of a brick, used for paving.
A molded sample of solidified cement or mortar for use as a test piece for showing the strength of the material.

verbs.description: briquette (third-person singular simple present briquettes, present participle briquetting, simple past and past participle briquetted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To form (coal, etc.) into small bricks.
